text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]p_1 = 1+t[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]p_2 = 2+t^2[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]p_3 = t-t^2[/mathjaxinline]. Fact: [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B} = \{ p_1; p_2; p_3\}[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}_2[/mathjaxinline].
What polynomial [mathjaxinline]q[/mathjaxinline] has the property that [mathjaxinline][q]_{\mathcal{B}} = \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline]?
Remember to type * for multiplication (so to enter [mathjaxinline]3t^2[/mathjaxinline], type 3*t^2).

font.p: If [mathjaxinline][q]_{\mathcal{B}} = \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]q = 1p_1 + 2p_2 + 3p_3.[/mathjaxinline] Thus we compute [mathjaxinline]q[/mathjaxinline] to be [mathjaxinline]5+4t -t^2[/mathjaxinline].
